ca.ualberta.cs.drivr

Class ElasticSearchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.drivr.ElasticSearchController

  • public class ElasticSearchController
extends java.lang.Object
    In ElasticSearchController, the actual calls to ElasticSearch are done. This requires the use of internal classes that use asynchronous tasks in order to perform these calls, as attempts at not using them have resulted in ElasticSearch not working. The controller contains 5 classes for requests and 2 for users. For requests, it can add a request, update it, search for requests by username, by location or by keyword. Requests are stored in a document that doesn't translate 1-to-1 with Request, requiring the use of a model class named ElasticSearchRequest used solely in this class and solely just for allowing Request to be gotten from ElasticSearch For users, it adds and updates users using the same class, and it can also search for a user.
    See Also:
    ElasticSearch, ElasticSearchRequest

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ElasticSearchController.AddRequest
      Here, a request is added to ElasticSearch by first building the add query for the document to be stored in ElasticSearch, then adding it into ElasticSearch, then immediately afterwards getting the ID where it's stored, appending it to the end of the add query and then replacing the query we just added with the new query including the ID.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.AddUser
      Here, the user is either added or updated (since this class handles both) in ElasticSearch by building it then adding it in the ID which is the same as the user's unique username.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.GetUser
      Here, we get a user profile by searching for the unique username and returning it when we find it.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForKeywordRequests
      Here, all the requests that have the description containing the keyword given by the user will be gotten.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForLocationRequests
      Here, the program will get take in the specified geolocation from the user, search within a 5 km radius for requests where the start locations are within that range and return the gotten requests.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.SearchForRequests
      Here, all requests associated to a user are gotten by checking all rider and driver usernames to see if they contain the user's username, adding them to the ArrayList and then returning that ArrayList.
      static class  ElasticSearchController.UpdateRequest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addRequests(java.util.ArrayList<Request> requests, java.util.ArrayList<ElasticSearchRequest> tempRequests)
      Here, the requests gotten from ElasticSearch will be converted to actual requests that can be stored within the app.
      static void verifySettings()
      Here, we set our client settings to make sure it's on the correct website where our ElasticSearch results are stored.

      • addRequests

        public static void addRequests(java.util.ArrayList<Request> requests,
                               java.util.ArrayList<ElasticSearchRequest> tempRequests)
        Here, the requests gotten from ElasticSearch will be converted to actual requests that can be stored within the app.
        Parameters:
        requests - The requests to be returned to the rest of the app
        tempRequests - The requests gotten from ElasticSearch.
